content: Announcements
Announcement 11 April, 13:52 CET
Hello dear Traders,
We have good news to share!
We have replaced the Round 1 performance evaluation data with fresh price data for Day 1.
We have also fixed the problem causing the short simulation instead of the full simulation against 1M timestamps for some of you.

Along with addressing the two issues mentioned above, it was brought to our attention that RAINFOREST_RESIN trader bots are behaving identically to AMETHYSTS trader bots from Prosperity 2. We have addressed this issue as well, by making sure RAINFOREST_RESIN trader bots will behave in a fresh and new way starting from Round 1 evaluation.

Round 1 performance evaluation update is currently underway in order to reflect the above 3 updates, and you might see your scores being updated already on the platform. In a short while we will go into a brief maintenance mode (expected to last up to 1 hour) where all scores from Round 1 will be updated in the Leaderboard and on the Archipelago view.  Due to above changes to trader bot behavior and use of fresh pricing data for Round 1, we will also be updating the "Data in a Bottle" which will be reflected post maintenance break. 

Thank you for your efforts and helping us to ensure fair play in Prosperity 3.

Good luck with the rest of Round 2!
/end of announcement
Announcement 10 April, 18:04 CET
Unfortunately we encountered 2 errors in performing Round 1 Algorithmic trading challenge simulation for which we want to share an update. Please read carefully.
What happened?

Round 1 price data (Day 1) was mistakenly published in “Data in a bottle” for a short period of time, causing some teams to gain an advantage by writing their algorithmic trades based on known Day 1 simulation data. The current scores in the leaderboard shows this unfair advantage.
Some teams only received simulation up to the first 100k timestamps instead of the complete 1M timestamps causing incomplete simulation seen in the scores on the leaderboard.
What will we do to resolve this?

We will use a fresh price data for Day_1 to evaluate Round 1 performance using your already uploaded algorithm scripts. No new submission for Round 1 will be allowed. The price data for Day -2, Day -1, and Day 0 on which you have based your trades when writing your scripts, will of course stay the same.
We will also fix the bug causing partial simulation and ensure running an entire simulation for all teams, so everyone’s last uploaded algo file will be evaluated based on the complete 1M timestamps.
When and how will this happen?

We will perform above changes during a short maintenance break during the current Round 2. We will let you know closer to the time we expect the platform to be down (this will at least not be in the next 16 hours). During this maintenance, we will update the leaderboard and Archipelago island with the new scores. You can continue making progress with Round 2 and find ideas to make more SeaShells trading the Picnic Baskets. 

We apologize for the inconvenience. We are working to ensure the gameplay is a fair and a pleasant experience for everyone and we appreciate all your efforts so far!

Please keep a look out at the ⁠announcements channel for more information on the upcoming maintenance mode.
/ End of announcement
